results.title: The Giving tree (K)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow, Shel Silverstein and Charlie O. Hayward
results.brief_description: This poignant story about the relationships between a boy and a tree illustrates some truths about the meaning of giving, receiving and love. the tree unselfishly offers itself to the boy for climbing, for shade and for pleasure. But as the boy grows up his life takes him further and further away from the tree. But old age brings their relationship full circle. Based on the book by Shel Silverstein. Music and narration by Shel Silverstein. Animation by Charlie O. Hayward.

results.title: The Girls and daddy
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Melodrama by D.W. Griffith about two young ladies and a burglar. The film is presented in two parts: first, the scenes in the order in which they were photographed, and then as edited. The first part is silent, and the second has a musical accompaniment. Cast includes David Miles, Florence Lawrence, Dorothy West, Mack Sennett.

results.title: The Girl who spelled freedom
results.creator_credit: R.W. Goodwin, Walt Disney Productions and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: Based on newspaper articles and personal interviews with Linn Yann, this moving film tells of one young Cambodian girl refugees experiences in America and her fight to be accepted. With the support of her caring American sponsors (played by Mary Kay Place and Wayne Rogers), Linn Yann (Jade Chinn) overcomes the strangeness of her new country and makes a name for herself by winning the regional spelling competition, thus bringing attention to the plight of other refugees like her.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, AFTRS, Television and Radio School and Richard Wherrett
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Frank Moorhouse, this is a lighthearted presentation of a man’s difficulty in coping with women’s liberation and the new position of some women in society.

results.title: The Girl on the bridge = La Fille sur le port [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Christian Fechner, UGC Images, Fechner Productions, Canal+, UGCF and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: Patrice Leconte (Monsieur Hire, Ridicule, The Hairdresser’s husband) directed this romantic fantasy about an aging knife thrower and a beautiful young wayward woman that he meets one night contemplating suicide on a bridge. Gabor (Daniel Auteuil) is a talented performer whose cool demeanour mirrors an emotional wasteland; Adele (Vanessa Paradis) has a history of bad luck, in particular regarding sexual experiences, which tend to leave her destitute and lonely. As Gabor and Adele join forces, they create a daring and erotic stage act and their luck turns to gold. The two share a telepathic bond that enables them to converse from separate locales and intensifies their mutual attraction, tested by Adele’s whimsical attractions to a myriad of suitors. Set in France and Monaco and shot in black and white the film is aesthetically pleasing with a charming soundtrack but at times seems to have the appearance (and depth) of a television commercial. “The Girl on the bridge” has a comical tone and its beguiling leads and exotic settings buoy the film making it a mostly enjoyable cinematic experience.

results.title: The Girl on a motorcycle = La Motocyclette
results.creator_credit: William Sassoon, Mid Atlantic Film, Ares Production and Jack Cardiff
results.brief_description: Girl on a motorcycle is an erotic fantasy film starring Marianne Faithful and Alain Delon. Rebecca (Faithful) is a bored English newly wed, whose husband fails to satisfy her emotionally or sexually. On a whim Rebecca flees to France on her motorcycle to be re-united with her former lover Daniel (Delon), who taught her a love of riding and gave her sexual satisfaction. Numerous flashback sequences reveal the history between Rebecca and Daniel. Whilst riding to meet Daniel, Rebecca (in voiceover) ruminates over the motivation behind her choices and the possibilities of her future. The film was released in 1968 in an edited version that was X-rated, under the title “Naked under leather”. This is the full length uncut version. In keeping with the times, the film features several psychedelic scenes.

results.title: The Girl of the golden west = La Fanciulla del west
results.creator_credit: Piero Faggioni, Covent Garden Video Productions, BBC-TV and John Vernon
results.brief_description: La Fanciulla del west, opera in three acts by Giacomo Puccini with libretto by Guelfo Givinini and Carlo Zangarini and based on the play by David Balesco was performed at The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden and starred world acclaimed opera singer Placido Domingo (Dick Johnson aka Ramirez the bandit). Adapted for television this penultimate opera of Puccini’s, set in California during the Gold rush, is quite spectacular both in set design and costuming. Placido Domingo is superbly supported by Carol Neblett (Minnie, “the girl of the Golden West”) and Silvano Carroli (Jack Rance, the sherrif) along with Robert Lloyd and Gwynne Howell. Features The Royal Opera Chorus and The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Nello Santi. Sung in Italian.

results.title: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Stephen Clarke
results.brief_description: This animated music video was created in 3D studio Max for student’s band - Positronic. Although it was the first time that he had used this software, he makes the most of simple scenes, metaphorical imagery and 3D ariel effects to effectively communicate the song’s message - A small town girl leaves her home to find fame and fortune in the big city, leaving beind her boyfriend who must come to terms with her departure.
